articles.author: Emily Rose, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel struck multiple targets in Lebanon on Sunday, pressing Iran-backed Hezbollah with more attacks after it struck a huge blow by killing the group's leader, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israel pounds Lebanon, pressuring Hezbollah after killing its leader

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Austrians elect a new parliament on Sunday with the far-right Freedom Party (FPO) aiming to secure its first general election win in a neck-and-neck race with the ruling conservatives that has been dominated by economic worries and immigration.
articles.title: Austria holds tight election with far right bidding for historic win

articles.author: Dave Graham
articles.description: Herbert Kickl must find a partner to form a stable coalition. Other party leaders loathe him and have refused to serve under him.
articles.title: Austria's far-right election victory delights Europe's right-wing parties

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States has dropped a push for the U.N. Security Council to ask for a plan to transform a security mission in Haiti - helping fight armed gangs - into a formal U.N. peacekeeping operation, a move made to appease Russia and China, diplomats say.
articles.title: US drops push for Haiti peacekeeping plan to appease China, Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel should not be allowed to attack countries in the Iran-aligned "Axis of Resistance" one after the other, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said on Sunday.
articles.title: Iran's president denounces Israeli attacks on Tehran's regional allies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The bomb that Israel used to kill Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut last week was an American-made guided weapon, a U.S. senator said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel used US-made bomb in attack on Hezbollah head, US senator says

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis said on Sunday victims of Catholic clergy sexual abuse in Belgium deserved more financial compensation, calling the amounts allocated to them so far "too small".
articles.title: Pope Francis says Belgian clergy abuse victims deserve more compensation

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: A senior government minister urged Moldovans on Sunday to shun "thieves, fugitives and bandits" after an exiled pro-Russian business magnate pledged to pay voters to vote "no" in a referendum on joining the European Union.
articles.title: Moldovan minister urges voters to shun 'thieves' after cash offered in EU referendum

articles.author: Kinda Makieh, Firas Makdesi
articles.description: Flags flew at half-mast in Damascus on Sunday and residents said they were still shocked after the killing of Hezbollah's chief Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, whose fighters helped Syria's army reclaim large parts of the country during its brutal civil war.
articles.title: Syrians mourn Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhzhia with multiple guided bombs on Sunday, wounding at least 16 people, and damaging railways, infrastructure, and residential and commercial buildings, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia city with guided bombs, injures 16
